intro: Tragia dodecandra, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is known for its hard, durable wood, which has been traditionally used for construction and tool-making. Tragia dodecandra is also valued for its medicinal properties in some traditional healing practices.
